Key Match Events: The A's lost to the Yankees with a score of 4-2 in 10 innings.
Pre-Game Insights: The A's players changed their walk-up/walkout songs to Bay Area artists as a tribute to Oakland.
Lawrence Butler said he wanted to let the fans know that he appreciates them and the city of Oakland.
Butler is hoping to get other teammates involved in the Bay Area-themed songs over the next week.
Post-Match Reflections: Butler said the crowd was amazing and showed out, but the team came out with a loss.
The fans were behind the team, and it was a competitive game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The A's are hosting several promotions and festivities to celebrate their final homestand at the Coliseum.
The team is relocating to Sacramento next season.
The announced crowd of 23,426 was only expected to grow larger in size with each passing game.
Others: The A's strength and conditioning coach Josh Cuffe put together a Bay Area-only playlist that sparked the idea for the players to change their walk-up songs.
